title.narrative: UNCTAD ICT statistics and women entrepreneurs
UNCTAD ICT statistik och kvinnliga företagare

description.narrative: Insatsens mål är att stärka utvecklingsländers kapacitet att producera internationellt jämförbar statistik inom ICT som möjliggör mer effektivt policyskapande inom bl.a. ICT4D.
The aim of the contribution is to strengthen developing countries capacity to produce internationally comparable ICT statistics that makes it possifle to create more effective policies within ICT4D.

UNCTAD/United Nations Conference on Trade and Development

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The UNCTAD program was divided in two components: 1. Building the capacity to measure the information economy for development2. Leveraging ICTs in support of women entrepreneurship in developing countries The first component was both including capacity building and development of on gender-based ICT indicators. The program targeted the problem of limitedawareness among ICT policy makers and the lack of technical capacity in NSOs. During the course of the project, 102 people from 56 countries were trained on the production of information economy statistics; of these, 48% of trainees were women (49 out of 102). Least developed countries (LDCs) made up 36% of all countries trained (20 out of 56). The number of certified trainers in information economy statistics has also increased from 5 to 13 trainers. This will not eradicate the challenges that was dealt with but it has brought a lot of competence to the area. Furthermore the development of the indicators has both brought the creation of a multi-stakeholder task group to develop gender and ICT statistics, the development of two publications, two new indicators on gender and ICT employment, and raised awareness of gender and ICT statistics. The second component was completed already 2013, "Leveraging ICTs in support of women entrepreneurship in developing countries" and Sida assess this part to be successful. The methodology of integrating the ICT dimension when assessing the environment for women's entrepreneurship development has been use in a number of countries. A publication - a practical guide "Empowering Women Entrepreneurs through Information and Communications Technologies" has received positive respond from key actors, and has been included in a list of the 100 most important studies on gender and development.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
